66129.message: My colleague was just tricked. EPAM did that for a while. Just to make it hard for him to change jobs because with a blue card, you can just stand up and leave. 66132.message: But with a national visa, this wonâ€™t work. Youâ€™ll have to start the process all over again, which is long, noticeably more expensive, and you can only stay in the country for two weeks without an active work contract (with a blue card â€” 3 months).

66133.message: Nope, not always a couple of weeks. It really depends on the voivodeship. I waited three months.

66134.message: Officially itâ€™s a couple of weeks. The voivodeship doesnâ€™t have the right to extend the deadlines. You can wait as long as you want only when youâ€™ve submitted the documents and are awaiting a decision from the administration.

66135.message: When I changed jobs, I consulted, and they told me there was a two-week window before and after the job change. You just fill out a form, provide a new contract, and a statement from the previous job â€” thatâ€™s it, no need to reissue the card, it's just a notification process.

66136.message: Youâ€™re probably talking about the residence permit. Yes, they stamp it. In general, I waited three months for the work permit and a year for the blue card. And with each passing year, the number of people wanting the card increases, so does the wait time.

66137.message: Everything I wrote earlier was about the national residence permit, not the blue card.

66138.message: The notification procedure for the blue card kicks in after 18 months from the first card issuance. Well, not the issuance, but the start date of its validity.

66139.message: I went through all this myself, Iâ€™m on my second card now, received it at the start of the month. It took a long time, yes, I submitted in early December. My wife still hasnâ€™t received hers. Iâ€™ve got a blue card.

If you donâ€™t leave the company during the payments, the amount is yours (the debt is canceled), but if you quit, you have to return everything theyâ€™ve paid you up to that point.

66214.message: Hereâ€™s an example: A prenuptial agreement can be declared invalid if it infringes on the rights of one of the parties. After 15 years, a split, 2 apartments (which were owned before the marriage and resold), and the second half gets nothing. The court: The rights were infringed because one party could have had an apartment, so the court says, OK, and thatâ€™s it :)

66215.message: Well, for example, my wife wouldnâ€™t have been able to join me now if we hadnâ€™t officially registered our marriage.

66217.message: That's how the prenup can be declared invalid.

66220.message: > 3. A prenuptial agreement cannot limit the legal capacity or capacity to act of the spouses, their right to seek protection of their rights in court; regulate personal non-property relations between spouses, the rights and duties of spouses in relation to children; provide for conditions limiting the right of an incapacitated, needy spouse to receive maintenance; include other conditions that put one of the spouses in an extremely unfavorable position or contradict the basic principles of family law.

66222.message: > In practice, an unequal division of property by itself is not a ground for declaring a prenuptial agreement invalid.

66223.message: Yeah, so all the property acquired is the property of the person it's registered to, and when they divorce, the wife is left with the kids and no housing â€” this clause put her in that situation.

66224.message: > The court can issue a decision to dismiss the claim even when the only property acquired during the marriage passes to one party without any compensation. For example, if the only apartment (in the absence of other property) goes to one spouse under the terms of the agreement, the court dismissed the claim to invalidate the contract.

66225.message: Keep that in mind before you start thinking about it.

66269.message: Well, Iâ€™m not trying to start a flame war. Iâ€™m just saying itâ€™s annoying. In Spain, by the way, this doesnâ€™t happen, even though theyâ€™re neighbors. Everything is probably thriving there too, but you have to look for it yourself. And nobody clings to you ðŸ™‚

66270.message: Portugal is a small and poor country by European standards. Considerably poorer than even Spain. And they had a very bad drug situation. They fought it the American way, by banning and crushing, and SURPRISE â€” it didnâ€™t help. Then some people realized that â€œthis is not a coincidence,â€ and they changed the policy to a more tolerant one. And it turned out to be very effective. But the journey isnâ€™t over, so youâ€™ll still find remnants.

It wasnâ€™t just a case of walking around during a layover for an hour. And weâ€™ve already figured out that Portugal hasnâ€™t delivered anything special yet, so thereâ€™s no interest. Sorry if I touched on some flame war topic, I didnâ€™t mean to ðŸ™‚
